I'm not quite sure what to make of this. I'm new to Eclipse, but this shouldn't be so hard.

This looks like configuration problem. please attach your .projectOptions file 
(inside theproject folder)
and send also your OS details.
Do you still see the problem with the latest PHP IDE version 0.7.0?
didn't get response from the person opened this bug

I've experienced this same kind of error on two 64-bit platforms under Fedora Core 6.  I am using the latest version (0.7.0) of the PHP IDE installed through the updates system of a vanilla Eclipse install.  There is no 64-bit all-in-one download for the PHP.

This has happened both on an Athlon 64 as well as a dual-core Pentium D 64-bit system.

Please let me know if there is any other information you guys would like me to test with, as this is a showstopper bug for me.

traces.message: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: The implementation does not support the requested type of object or operation.
